intro: Dombeya ivohibeensis subsp. ankaizinensis, commonly known as the Ankaizina Dombeya, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant is shrub-like, with simple, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native habitat.
